7. Hindsight bias: People have a tendency to retroactively interpret events as being more predictable than they actually were, leading them to believe that they knew all along that a particular outcome would occur. This can reinforce incorrect ideas and make it difficult to learn from mistakes.

By understanding these cognitive biases, one can better recognize when they are being manipulated or deceived by misinformation, and take steps to correct their thinking and seek out accurate information instead.
